[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs + secure/net] [Constant: MAX_MESSAGE_SIZE] [Memory exhaustion] Can attackers send multiple concurrent 80MB messages to exhaust server memory and cause validator crashes? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs + secure/net] [Function: GRPCNetworkMessageServiceServerWrapper::new] [Handler injection] Can malicious code register handlers in inbound_handlers HashMap to intercept messages intended for legitimate services? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs + secure/net] [Function: GRPCNetworkMessageServiceServerWrapper::start] [Shutdown race] Can calling start() multiple times create multiple server instances listening on same port, causing connection confusion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs + secure/net] [Function: start_async] [Timeout bypass] Can attackers craft requests that complete just under the rpc_timeout_ms limit repeatedly to monopolize server resources? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs + secure/net] [Function: start_async] [Reflection service abuse] Can the tonic_reflection service expose sensitive schema information or be exploited to probe for undocumented RPC methods? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs + secure/net] [Function: start_async] [Graceful shutdown bypass] Can malicious long-running requests prevent server shutdown by ignoring the shutdown signal? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs + secure/net] [Function: simple_msg_exchange implementation] [Handler lookup race] Can concurrent modifications to inbound_handlers HashMap cause race conditions when looking up handlers for incoming messages? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs + secure/net] [Function: simple_msg_exchange implementation] [Channel overflow] When handler.send(msg) is called, can channel buffer overflow if receiver is slow, causing message drops or deadlocks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs + secure/net] [Function: simple_msg_exchange implementation] [Error handling bypass] When no handler is registered, the error is logged but Empty response is returned - can this be exploited to silently drop important messages? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs + secure/net] [Function: simple_msg_exchange implementation] [Remote address spoofing] Can the remote_addr() value be trusted, or can attackers spoof source addresses to bypass access control checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs + secure/net] [Function: simple_msg_exchange implementation] [Message type collision] If two different services register the same MessageType string, which handler receives the message and can this cause routing confusion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs + secure/net] [Struct: Message::new] [Message ownership] When message bytes are wrapped in Message::new(), can the original sender retain references causing use-after-free vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs + secure/net] [Struct: MessageType::new] [Type validation] Does MessageType::new() validate that message_type string is from an allowed set, or can arbitrary strings be used? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs + secure/net] [Function: GRPCNetworkMessageServiceClientWrapper::new] [Synchronous blocking] Since new() uses block_on() to establish connection, can slow or malicious servers cause the calling thread to hang indefinitely? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs + secure/net] [Function: get_channel] [Lazy connection exploit] Since connect_lazy() is used, can the first actual RPC fail unexpectedly and how are these failures handled in critical paths? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs + secure/net] [Function: get_channel] [Insecure transport] The connection uses 'http://' instead of 'https://' - are messages sent in plaintext allowing eavesdropping on remote execution commands? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs + secure/net] [Function: send_message] [Panic on failure] The code panics when simple_msg_exchange fails - can this be exploited to crash nodes by triggering network failures? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs + secure/net] [Function: send_message] [Missing retry logic] The TODO comment mentions retry with exponential backoff - can transient failures cause permanent message loss in critical execution paths? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs + secure/net] [Function: send_message] [Sender address spoofing] Can attackers manipulate the sender_addr parameter to impersonate other nodes in the network? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs + secure/net] [Function: send_message] [Concurrent access] Can multiple threads calling send_message on the same client instance cause data races in remote_channel? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs + secure/net] [Function: InboundHandler::new] [Handler initialization] Can services register handlers before start() is called, creating race conditions in handler setup? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs + secure/net] [Function: InboundHandler::register_handler] [Duplicate registration] The assert prevents duplicate registration, but can this cause panics in production if services accidentally re-register handlers? (Medium)
